intro: Neja ciliaris, commonly known as the silverleaf neja, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Neja ciliaris is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
